text: I think I'd decriminalize I think I
would heavily regulate and control I
think I if you're asking me and you know
my mouth is no prayer book but my view
is I'd view addiction to these
substances as a medical problem and I
would treat it accordingly what little I
knew about the history of drug control
policy in the United States leaves me
thinking that a hugely important moment
came when the lawyers went out over the
doctors on this matter that is to say
when the medical profession basically
surrendered and perhaps they had no
choice in the matter their autonomy to
handle the difficult problems of
addiction to substances which is a
medical
problem uh to the uh anti-drug Crusaders
legal Crusaders who uh wanted to make
everything against the law and then uh
throw people in prison um just as we can
see in retrospect that criminalizing the
consumption of alcohol proved not to be
the solution to the very real problem of
drunkenness so to what I want to say is
the very real problem of the human
susceptibility to addiction isn't best
dealt with by building prisons and
throwing people into
jails
